blocks.text: corresponding strips so that a continuous curve results, known as the Sum Curve. Thus $ab$ parallel to $PB'$ is drawn from $m$ across the second strip, and so on.
The ordinate to the sum curve through any point in the base gives the area under the original or primitive curve from $a$ up to the point considered.

blocks.caption: Area of strip $abba'$ as $ab 	imes AB$
rows: $m$ measures the area of the first strip to a particular scale, which depends entirely on the value of $h$.
